p: Furthermore, the lowland Treene, a groundwater‐dominated river with low variability in flow conditions, may respond slower to climate change compared to the Kinzig. The stable flow regime may cause more generalists and fewer specialists to occur in the Treene (only five habitat specialists) compared to a higher proportion of specialists in the Kinzig (26 habitat specialists, according to Schmidt‐Kloiber & Hering, 2015). Therefore, the species assemblages of the Treene reaches might cope better with the flow alterations compared to the Kinzig catchment.
